title: nDimensionV/nDimensionI (in THSTensor) is confusingly named
body_html:
In THSTensor, nDimensionV is stated to be the "dimension of values". But it is not actually sparse._values().dim(); it is one LESS than this, because the actual values tensor also has an nnz dimension.

Similarly, nDimensionI is stated to be the "dimension of indices", but sparse._indices().dim() is always 2.
body_text:
In THSTensor, nDimensionV is stated to be the "dimension of values". But it is not actually sparse._values().dim(); it is one LESS than this, because the actual values tensor also has an nnz dimension.
Similarly, nDimensionI is stated to be the "dimension of indices", but sparse._indices().dim() is always 2.
body:
In THSTensor, nDimensionV is stated to be the "dimension of values". But it is not actually `sparse._values().dim()`; it is one LESS than this, because the actual values tensor also has an nnz dimension.

Similarly, nDimensionI is stated to be the "dimension of indices", but `sparse._indices().dim()` is always 2.
